title: Basic configuration intended for customers who have no experience with Sippy softswitch.
description:
General information


It provides a clue on how to configure the basic system features. When you follow this list, you can install the real vendor settings and configure your first call routing, so after the basic list, you will be able to make a test call.


1. Create a Vendor.


2. Create Connections and set required data to all fields. Add number translation based on the picture (if it is required).


3. Create  Destination Set with all required fields. Add routes and all required fields (via "Action" column in the Destination Sets menu). Also, you can upload routes from *.xls file upload/download.


Discuss the picture from this article:  https://support.sippysoft.com/en/support/solutions/articles/77554-understanding-rating-and-billing


4. Create Routing Group. Add all settings and their combinations to the routing group based on our official documentation.


5. Create Tariff and specify values. Some fields:  Loss Protection,  Local Calling,  AVG call duration.

  • Grace period - when this parameter is set to non-zero value calls with durations of less than this value are not charged.
  • Post Call Surcharge - additional charge, which is calculated as a percentage of the amount charged, that is if the call cost is 1 dollar and the PostCallSurcharge is 0.01 (0.01 means 1%), the actual amount charged will be 1.01 dollar.

Also please look to the following image:  

https://s3.amazonaws.com/cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/4995882/original/charging_parameters.png?1366383466


6. Create  Service Plan. Fill the appropriet fields.


7. Accounts Configuration. Specify the following parameters in the account properties:

- Routing Group

- Service Plans

- Translation Rules

- Authentication Rules


8. Test Dialplan. The main customer tool to check his configuration.


9.  Sippy Reseller aka Customers. & Permissions.


10. Look to the Sippy reporting, CDR reports,  ASR/ACD reports, Summary reports.


This is basically what you need for the first call attempt. After this you can play with some additional features.


11.  Payment Processors/ Topup Vouchers.

12.  IVR Applications.

13.  DID Pool.

14. System Parameters.

15. Tools.

-  CSR Generator - Generate HTTPS Certificate;

- Looking Glass - Ping/traceroute hosts of your vendors/customers to check ip;

- IP Traffic Dump / Network Traffic Capture;

-  Rerate CDRs;
